options.text: All Chondrichthyes are marine animals with a streamlined body with some exceptions
Larva of all cyclostomates return to fresh water after metamorphosis
Chelone and Testudo are able to maintain a constant body temperature

solution.text:
Chondrichthyes : They are marine animals with a streamlined body and have cartilaginous endoskeleton.

Placental mammal (infraclass Eutheria), any member of the mammalian group characterized by the presence of a placenta, which facilitates exchange of nutrients and wastes between the blood of the mother and that of the fetus. The placentals include all living mammals except marsupials and monotremes

Cyclostomes are marine but migrate for spawning to fresh water. After spawning, within a few days, they die. Their larvae, after metamorphosis, return to the ocean.

Chelone and Testudo (reptiles) are not able to maintain a constant body temperature
